title: Perth Invasion Day rally attempted bombing declared terrorist act | ABC NEWS
description: The attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally crowd in Perth was a terrorist act, authorities have declared. A 31-year-old man was last week charged with throwing what police described as a homemade "fragment bomb", filled with ball bearings and screws, into the crowd which had gathered in central Perth. title: Why the 'Lucky Generation' without mortgages is still dismayed by RBA rate hike | ABC NEWS
description: A group of retirees has mixed feelings about the Reserve Bank's call to increase interest rates for the first time in two years. title: Herzog visit an opportunity for 'solidarity' with Australia: Colin Rubenstein | ABC NEWS
description: Colin Rubenstein, executive director of the Australia/Israel & Jewish Affairs Council says Israeli President Isaac Herzog's trip to Australia is "timely" and a "mission of condolence" in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack. The controversial visit arranged by the Australian government has faced some criticism, with fears it will fuel division. Isaac Herzog has previously made statements found by a UN inquiry to be an incitement to genocide of Palestinians. Councillor Rubenstein rejects the UN inquiry's findings, claiming the Israeli president's statements have been "misrepresented". title: Milan: Is this Australia's best ever Winter Olympics team?
description: Australia's best medal haul at a Winter Olympics is four, back in Beijing in 2022. The 53-strong team sent to Milano-Cortina could be the group to better that result. Can Scotty James complete his Olympic medal set and finally win gold? Can 16-year-old Indra Brown earn a podium on her Olympic debut? Will Jakara Anthony defend her title in the moguls? Your guide to what could be a generational Winter Olympics for Australia.¬†   Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)
